ai-mn22:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn22:2.1_0: Now at that time a mendicant called Ariṭtha, who had previously been a vulture trapper, had the following harmful misconception:
ai-mn22:2.2_0: “As I understand the Teaching of the Buddha, the things he calls obstructive are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them.”

ai-mn22:13.5_0: “Suppose there was a person traveling along the road.
ai-mn22:13.6_0: They’d see a large deluge, whose near shore was dubious and perilous, while the far shore was a sanctuary free of peril.
ai-mn22:13.7_0: But there was no ferryboat or bridge for crossing over.
ai-mn22:13.9_0: ‘This is a large deluge, a sanctuary free of peril.
ai-mn22:13.10_0: But there’s no ferryboat or bridge for crossing over.
ai-mn22:13.11_0: ‘Why don’t I gather grass, sticks, branches, and leaves and make a raft? Riding on the raft, and paddling with my hands and feet, I can safely reach the far shore.’
ai-mn22:13.12_0: And so they’d do exactly that.
ai-mn22:13.13_0: And when they’d crossed over to the far shore, they’d think,
ai-mn22:13.14_0: ‘This raft has been very helpful to me. ...

ai-mn22:13.16_0: Why don’t I hoist it on my head or pick it up on my shoulder and go wherever I want?’
ai-mn22:13.18_0: Would that person be doing what should be done with that raft?”

ai-mn22:13.22_0: ‘This raft has been very helpful to me. ...

ai-mn22:13.25_0: That’s what that person should do with the raft.
ai-mn22:13.26_0: In the same way, I have taught how the teaching is similar to a raft: it’s for crossing over, not for holding on.

ai-mn22:29.1_0: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.

ai-mn22:36.4_0: Because even in the present life the Realized One is undiscoverable, I say.
ai-mn22:37.1_0: Though I speak and explain like this, certain ascetics and brahmins misrepresent me with the false, hollow, lying, untruthful claim:
ai-mn22:37.2_0: ‘The ascetic Gotama is an exterminator. He advocates the annihilation, eradication, and obliteration of an existing being.’
ai-mn22:37.3_0: I have been falsely misrepresented as being what I am not, and saying what I do not say.
ai-mn22:37.4_0: ‘The ascetic Gotama is an exterminator. He advocates the annihilation, eradication, and obliteration of an existing being.’
ai-mn22:37.5_0: In the past, as today, what I describe is suffering and the cessation of suffering.
ai-mn22:37.6_0: This being so, if others abuse, attack, harass, and trouble the Realized One, he doesn’t get resentful, bitter, and emotionally exasperated.
ai-mn22:38.1_0: Or if others honor, respect, revere, or venerate him, he doesn’t get thrilled, elated, and emotionally excited.
ai-mn22:38.3_0: ‘They do such things for what has already been completely understood.’
ai-mn22:39.1_0: So, mendicants, if others abuse, attack, harass, and trouble you, don’t make yourselves resentful, bitter, and emotionally exasperated.
ai-mn22:39.2_0: Or if others honor, respect, revere, or venerate you, don’t make yourselves thrilled, elated, and emotionally excited.
